content: Singaporean venture capitalist **Jenny Lee** (born 1972) is a Singaporean [venture capitalist](/wiki/Venture_capital) and Senior Managing Partner of [Granite Asia](/wiki/Granite_Asia) based in Singapore. Lee was the first woman venture capitalist to break into the top 10 of [Forbes](/wiki/Forbes) [Midas List](/wiki/Midas_List) in 2015. In 2019, she ranked #86 on [Forbes World's 100 Most Powerful Women list](/wiki/Forbes_list_of_The_World%27s_100_Most_Powerful_Women), and in 2021, ranked #33 on [The Midas List](/wiki/Midas_List). She also appeared on the Midas List in 2024. ## Early and personal life Lee was born in Singapore to a Chinese schoolteacher father and a housewife mother. Her brother Hong Meng is an engineer. She was a student of [CHIJ Saint Nicholas Girls' School](/wiki/CHIJ_Saint_Nicholas_Girls%27_School) and [Hwa Chong Junior College](/wiki/Hwa_Chong_Junior_College). She is married to Vincent Koh.[*citation needed*] ## Career A [ST Engineering](/wiki/ST_Engineering) scholar, she studied engineering at [Cornell University](/wiki/Cornell_University) in New York from 1991 to 1995 and graduated with a [Bachelor of Arts and Science](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Arts_and_Science) and a [Master of Science](/wiki/Master_of_Science). Upon her return, she joined [ST Aerospace](/wiki/ST_Aerospace) as a jet engineer. In 2001, she obtained a [Master of Business Administration](/wiki/Master_of_Business_Administration) from the [Kellogg School of Management](/wiki/Kellogg_School_of_Management) in Chicago. In 2001, she returned to Singapore.[*citation needed*] She found a job with [Morgan Stanley](/wiki/Morgan_Stanley) in Hong Kong. A year later, she joined Japanese venture-capital firm, [JAFCO Asia](/wiki/JAFCO_Asia).[*citation needed*] Lee joined [GGV Capital](/wiki/GGV_Capital) as a managing partner in 2005 and was involved in setting up its first China office. While working with GGV, the firm invested in startups such as [Alibaba](/wiki/Alibaba_Group), [Didi Chuxing](/wiki/DiDi_(company)), [Xiaomi](/wiki/Xiaomi), [Toutiao](/wiki/Toutiao), and [Grab](/wiki/Grab_(company)). In March 2024, Lee and Jixun Foo led the newly formed firm, [Granite Asia](/wiki/Granite_Asia) after it was split off from GGV Capital. - Official website This business-related biographical article from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Jenny Lee (venture capitalist)
